issue.title: www.amazon.com

labels.name: A: In progress

labels.name: A: Waiting for data

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://www.amazon.com/gp/video/detail/B08GBYWQ6W/ref=atv_dp_season_select_s5?jic=8%7CEgNhbGw%3D](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2Fgp%2Fvideo%2Fdetail%2FB08GBYWQ6W%2Fref%3Datv_dp_season_select_s5%3Fjic%3D8%257CEgNhbGw%253D) ### Comment > Even with AdGuard enabled, Amazon Prime plays ads of other offerings between episodes. AdGuard fails to disable these ads like it does in YouTube. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/iznj6k7uzj4kckwsg8ko8okc0ck8sowa1uu5h6uemo.jpg?nc=1)

comment.body: After rebooting my Mac, the above “[Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/195865#issuecomment-2620511584)” is now happening in response to these 2 filters only when the add-on is enabled.  For some reason, it was happening for a while before when it was either on or off.  Either way, these shouldn’t be blocking legitimate related item links from loading on any site when clicked.  And it was only in recent months when it started happening, which is why I had to disable AG on Amazon.
